Name: Permitting interested parties to receive notification of items published in the City Record.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting interested parties to receive notification of items published in the City Record

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted

Summary: This bill would permit individuals to sign up to receive email notifications on items in the City Record. The purpose of this legislation is to increase public access to up-to-date information about City political processes.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 23 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 23-107 to read as follows:
      � 23-107 Notification of items in City Record. a. The website of the City Record shall permit individuals to sign up to receive e-mail notifications relating to information published in the City Record. 
      b. Such website shall: 
      1. Permit individuals to limit their receipt of such notifications by, at minimum, relevant agency, affected community board district and category, such as public hearings, agency rules and procurement notices; and
      2. Include a short description of the core functions of each available agency. 
	� 2. This local law takes effect 180 days after it becomes law.
      

DSS/JJ/cjm
LS #567/Int. 0380-2014
LS #5632 
08/19/2020
Committee on Transportation
